Keywords: Guardians of the Galaxy , Ruler , Skrulls , Soldier , Spy , Warrior
Real Name: Kl’rt
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Captain
USE YOUR ENEMY’S POWER AGAINST THEM: FREE: Choose a friendly Sidekick and a displayed standard attack power that an opposing character adjacent to that Sidekick can use. The chosen Sidekick can use that power this turn.
LEADING THE INVASION FORCES: Leadership, Shape Change. When Super Skrull uses Leadership and succeeds you may instead generate a AFFE #002 Skrull Spy on click #1.

Comments
June 30, 2022
AdamWarlock
I feel like people are sleeping on this figure. I sure have been. I must have assumed his full dial was 100 points. For just 75 points, 8 clicks is a quite long dial and with 50%-chance shape change on every click he's a royal pain to put down. His full dial of 3 damage isn't anything IMPRESSIVE but its respectable - and ripe for abuse with the power gem equipped. With the power gem this guy is a BEAST - and you'll still have 215 points left to work with! This guy is largely ignored because of the much flashier take on the character from just a few sets prior - and its a shame.
December 19, 2021
Brundun94
"...you'd hope it'd at least be one that had low end casual value, and this guy has neither." I don't know, maybe casual is very different at most other locations. And I have really enjoyed rolling out Amazon armies, but maybe my leadership rolls have been above average. This guy would perform well at my store. That imperv and full dial 4 - 6 prob would give problems. No charge, no super senses, no CCE, and other tools that add versatility, sure. But he gives you added value with his spies. On a Skrull theme alone, there's several options for empower that make those guys shine in a fight. And extra 2 clicks of life for the same points, with defend and strong dv's. Idk, just feels like there are a lot of worse ways to spend 75 points from recent years.
December 17, 2021
SpaceTitanium
People aren't complaining that he's not meta, people are complaining that he (and a majority of this set) is boring. not everyone has to have have high end competitive value, but when they're a redo of a character we got just last year you'd hope it'd at least be one that had low end casual value, and this guy has neither. He's unimpressive across the board and suffers the same issue the majority of captain/sidekick characters do, he forgoes any interesting mechanic or solo effects in order to help out grunts that are vanilla and boring on their own. With how lame most of the sidekicks tend to be, it just ends up feeling like you're getting less than the sum of your parts unless you minmax the gimmick. While playing them apart from the gimmick just ends up with them seeming real plain as their only defining aspect is absent. Compare him to the super skrull from FF and you have a much more versatile and flavourful dial that represents his powers much better than this. Ignoring the sidekick gimmick entirely he has pure vanilla powers with mook generation. With the mook generation he gets a bit more interesting because of the power copy, but even that isn't great as it's entirely ependant on what your opponent is playing and a number of the powers you may steal range from useless to situational (Psychic blast, EE, super strength, TK). It's a whole lot of Ifs and Maybes for the figure to do anything beyond baseline functionality. End of the day, this figure in particular feels lame as despite decent numbers he is otherwise nothing to write home about. Only thing he has going for him is the GOTG keyword/TA, Otherwise i'm reaching for the F4 version every time.
December 13, 2021
Brundun94
Listen, I'm not saying he's meta, but you all do realize that he's designed to be a team player/squad leader for Skrulls, and a thumping good one, too, I might add. Him and all his Skrull buddies will be sporting 4 - 6 shape change, while his spy buddies steal attack powers (poison, bcf, precision strike, smoke cloud, etc.). CAAV and FF badly spoiled the game, from casual through all levels of competitive play. We expect that if a 50 point piece can't fire off a minimum 6 damage in a turn and effectively grant you 9 clicks of life, it's junk. De-power away, wizkids. Undo this mess you made. Lotta complaining about the design in the last few sets, but this game can't continue to handle the inflation. This is a good piece, and a lot of pieces getting thrashed in this set are actually very playable. I'm sorry not every one has high end competitive viability.
December 8, 2021
Goop
He might see some play at his lower line for Sidekick generation, beyond that his top line isn't great. Incap with 2 targets is pretty weak for 75pts. The sidekick stealing power is extremely situational. He does have the 50/50 SC and good def but he is just so much weaker than the Super Skrull from F4 set.
